#n, k0
{2, -3}
#Integrated cross section, s = sign(k0), m = |k0|; {s*(m-2), -s(m-1), sm, -s(m+1), s(m+2)}
{1, 1, 6, 1, 1}
#coefficients 5x5 table, rows and column index refer to the same kappa as the column index for the integrated cross section
{{0, -0.5345224838248488, 1.167023009850092, 0, 0}, {-0.5345224838248488, -0.7142857142857143, -0.9911469766813324, -0.8998125585734124, 0}, {1.167023009850092, -0.9911469766813324, -5.189077702643697, 1.259174396943867, 2.861194868967255}, {0, -0.8998125585734124, 1.259174396943867, 0.1700680272108844, 0.2405125106076692}, {0, 0, 2.861194868967255, 0.2405125106076692, 0.9523809523809524}}
#The one photon case follows. The final kappas are sorted as {s(m-1),-sm,s(m+1)} and the coefficients then end up in a 3x3 table instead.
#Denominator coefficients:
{1.0, 1.0, 1.0}
#Numerator coefficients:
{{0.2, 0.32071349029490926162, -1.43427433120127236794}, {0.32071349029490926162, -0.91428571428571428571, -0.38332593899996394796}, {-1.43427433120127236794, -0.38332593899996394796, 0.71428571428571428571}}
